properties.title: Protesters allowed to vent anger at Putin
properties.description: Russia’s political opposition was allowed the rare opportunity to hold a legal anti-government demonstration in Moscow on Sunday, an unusual sign of political tolerance by the capital’s new mayor

properties.title: IMF warns on fragility of global recovery
properties.description: The worldwide recovery remains fragile and countries have done little to redress imbalances in the global economy, according to the International Monetary Fund

properties.title: Fitch downgrades Ireland’s debt rating
properties.description: Ireland’s debt rating has been downgraded by Fitch with a further downgrade more than likely in the next two years, the credit rating agency said

properties.title: China and India output jumps sharply
properties.description: Manufacturers sharply increased output in China and India in October, powered largely by rising domestic demand and defying a widespread slowdown in the rest of Asia

properties.title: Rousseff wins Brazilian presidency
properties.description: Dilma Rousseff of the ruling leftwing PT won a comfortable victory in Brazil’s presidential run-off election on Sunday, beating her rival José Serra of the centrist opposition PSDB after failing to secure an outright majority at the first round on October 3

properties.title: Obama in final push on midterms
properties.description: President Barack Obama made a last-ditch effort to encourage Democrats to vote on Election Day, even as polls showed that Republicans were on the verge of a sweeping victory that would give them control of the House of Representatives

properties.title: BoJ praised for ‘decisive’ economic plan
properties.description: The Bank of Japan has set a course towards quantitative easing, drawing praise from Tokyo policymakers eager to see the central bank do more to shore up the nation’s faltering recover

properties.title: Treasury puts cost of rescue effort at $29bn
properties.description: The US Treasury forecast that the core of the financial rescue would cost $29bn, a fraction of initial estimates, but acknowledged it would lose ‘substantial’ money supporting the mortgage system

properties.title: Molecular research wins Nobel chemistry prize
properties.description: Two Japanese and one American researcher have won the 2010 Nobel prize for chemistry, for developing a pioneering technique to create sophisticated carbon-based molecules with uses that range from fighting cancer to producing thin computer screens

properties.title: Gunmen attack Nato trucks in Pakistan
properties.description: Gunmen in Pakistan attack and set fire to 20 trucks transporting supplies for Nato troops in Afghanistan, the latest in a series of attacks on the supply chain for the war

properties.title: Japan condemns Medvedev trip to disputed islands
properties.description: Japan has condemned a visit by Dmitry Medvedev, Russian president, to a disputed group of islands seized by Moscow during the second world war

properties.title: Bomb fears shift to passenger flights
properties.description: Global air safety concerns shifted abruptly from cargo to passenger flights on Sunday night after Qatar Airways confirmed that one of the bombs posted from Yemen last week was carried on its aircraft before being seized in Dubai

properties.title: Sino-Japan dispute overshadows summit
properties.description: US secretary of state Hillary Clinton found herself in the midst of a flare-up in smouldering Sino-Japanese relations that eclipsed the rest of the east Asia Summit in Hanoi

properties.title: China plans manned space station by 2020
properties.description: China has hailed its latest success in space as Chang’e 2, the country’s second lunar probe, successfully sent back high-resolution pictures that are going to be used to plan the country’s first unmanned moon landing in 2013

properties.title: Late deal agreed to pass Portugal budget
properties.description: The Socialist government and the opposition Social Democrats have struck a deal that ensures the budget will be approved when parliament votes on it on Wednesday

properties.title: Global disease fund fails to hit target
properties.description: More than $8bn of existing disease programme grants agreed in principle by the fund has not yet been financed

properties.title: French national killed in Yemen
properties.description: In the latest assault on western interests in Yemen, a French national has been killed in an attack in a western oil company compound in Sana’a, the capital. Separately, another person was injured when a British embassy vehicle was targeted

properties.title: German industrial orders surge 3.4%
properties.description: Germany saw a surge in manufacturing orders in August, boosting hopes that Europe’s largest economy will still power growth across the continent even as the euro strengthens and US recovery splutters

properties.title: US private sector sheds 39,000 jobs
properties.description: US businesses shed workers for the first time in eight months in September as slowing output has hampered the economy’s ability to create jobs

properties.title: Fed poised for biggest decision in decades
properties.description: The world’s most important central bank is expected to use quantitative easing as a routine instrument of monetary policy for the first time

properties.title: ECB raises interest rates to 1.5%
properties.description: A second increase this year marks the European Central Bank increased battle against inflation, despite the threat to the 17-country region

properties.title: Libyan rebels renew push on Tripoli
properties.description: Advance, aided by Nato bombs, is the latest in a series of attacks that aims to break the conflict’s deadlock

properties.title: Voluntary Greek debt plan ‘unrealistic’
properties.description: The Dutch finance minister says mandatory private sector participation in a second debt-relief support package should be considered

properties.title: Tokyo moves threaten nuclear restart
properties.description: Japan’s government stands accused of botching its nuclear energy policy after a mayor withdrew his consent to restart two atomic reactors

properties.title: Singh loses cabinet minister over scandal
properties.description: India’s textiles official, Dayanidhi Maran, resigns following allegations he abused his power while telecoms minister

properties.title: Europe lashes out over downgrades
properties.description: Senior officials question the timing of Moody’s downgrade of Portuguese bonds and threaten new regulatory action against all three major agencies

properties.title: Fresh charges in S Korean football scandal
properties.description: Prosecutors accuse 46 players of match-fixing, posing uncomfortable questions about the depth of sporting corruption in the country

properties.title: Brown leads California into ‘inevitable’ age of austerity
properties.description: In trying to close a $9.6bn deficit, the 73-year-old California governor last week signed a budget into law that took the axe to cherished programmes

properties.title: Republicans lay out conditions for tax rises
properties.description: Eric Cantor, House majority leader, said reductions in tax breaks for wealthy Americans and some businesses would have to be paired with new tax cuts

properties.title: Sudan’s oil gulf like a ‘poker game’
properties.description: Two days before Sudan splits in two, negotiating teams have failed to agree how to divide the oil critical to the economies of north and south
